title: tidytuesday3
contents: I created this graph to help answer which distributors have the most nominees in 2020 and 2021. year is one important variable and thus my first step was to filter to information for these two years. Then I grouped by distributor and year to compute how many nominees for each distributor each year. The next step was to group by distributor to find the total nominees for each distributor these two years and filter to distributors who have a total of more than 50 nominees. It is clear from the plot that Netflix has the most nominees, though more distributors became more competitive in 2021. I also found it interesting that HBO Max, launched in 2020, had a great performance with more than 100 nominees in its first year.

title: Tidy Tuesday #2
contents: I created this graph to help answer which songs rank No.1 for more than 10 weeks. Weeks ranked No.1 is the most important variable for my focus and thus my first step was to remove songs whose week position is not 1. Then I grouped by song_id to compute the total weeks ranked No.1 for each song. y-axis was restructured to rank the songs from the longest to the shortest time. Old Town Road ranked No.1 for the longest time (almost 20 weeks), followed by One Sweet Day and Despacito for 16 weeks. The total weeks on chart (ranked top 100) is also included. Although Macarena is not in the top 3, it was on chart for the longest time. There seems to be no relationship between weeks on chart and weeks ranked No.1.

title: Tidy Tuesday #1
contents: I created this graph to help answer whether the fastest lap speeds are similar for different races and how frequently the drivers join a race. Because there are over 1000 races and over 800 drivers and I was trying to make a gif, I only focused on races 1-50 to not overwhelm the audience with too much information. fastestLapSpeed is the most important variable for my focus and thus my first step was to remove all missing values. I also changed it to numeric so that it was possible to create a continuous y-axis. y-axis labels were restructured as well to better present the points mostly in the middle of the graph. A scatterplot was chosen since I wanted to underscore the overall trend and clutter of points could help achieve so. From the gif, it seems that the fastest lap speeds fluctuate in different races and that drivers with id 1-50 are the most frequent players.
